meanings.definition: Beyond what is normal or natural; inexplicable.
meanings.sent1: The preternatural glow of the fireflies lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The scientist was amazed by the preternatural abilities of the rare species.
meanings.sent3: The preternatural speed at which the tortoise won the race left everyone in shock.
meanings.sent4: Her preternatural intuition always seemed to guide her in the right direction.
meanings.sent5: The preternatural silence in the haunted house sent shivers down their spines.

meanings.definition: Existing outside of the natural order.
meanings.sent1: The preternatural creatures in the fantasy novel captivated the readers.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins held a preternatural beauty that was both eerie and enchanting.
meanings.sent3: The preternatural calm of the storm made everyone suspicious of its true nature.
meanings.sent4: The preternatural stillness of the lake mirrored the tranquility of her mind.
meanings.sent5: The preternatural colors of the sunset painted the sky in a mesmerizing display.

meanings.sent1: The preternatural strength of the superhero saved the city from disaster.
meanings.sent2: The magician's preternatural abilities left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent3: The preternatural size of the pumpkin at the fair broke all records.
meanings.sent4: The preternatural talent of the young artist was evident in every brushstroke.
meanings.sent5: The preternatural speed of the cheetah was unmatched in the animal kingdom.
